function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Local perceptions and cultural norms may influence the acceptability and adaptability of program tools for disease control.","Impact":"Low acceptability and adaptability of control tools may result in ineffective disease control and increased spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Conducting thorough community engagement and understanding local knowledge and perceptions of technology to tailor control tools to specific communities.","Technologies":"Community engagement platforms, culturally sensitive communication tools, and participatory design methods for program tools.","People":"Local communities and social groups at risk of inadequate disease control measures.","Owner":"Local health authorities and community leaders."},{"Description":"Over-reliance on one or two disease control tools may lead to ineffective and unsustainable disease control efforts.","Impact":"Ineffective disease control and increased risk of contagious diseases spreading due to limited and unsustainable control strategies.","Mitigation":"Implementing integrated and site-specific disease control interventions, taking into account social-ecological context, local livelihoods, and political factors.","Technologies":"Adaptive and iterative problem-solving approaches, site-specific intervention design, and interdisciplinary collaboration for sustainable development.","People":"Communities at risk of vector-borne diseases and local health authorities.","Owner":"Health organizations and interdisciplinary research teams."}]}
